title: Reports about the imminent death of big banks are greatly exaggerated
text:
Earlier this week the consultancy group McKinsey brought out a report saying banks are facing a “do or die” moment and that roughly a third of them were at risk when the next global downturn hits.

Right on cue, Royal Bank of Scotland posted a woeful set of results on Thursday. The state-controlled lender fell to an operating loss of £8m in the third quarter compared to an operating profit of £961m a year ago. The latest switching figures, which are also out today, showed that RBS lost a net 10,440 current account customers in the third quarter.

Welcome to your new job Alison Rose. And good luck!

Part of McKinsey’s thesis was that too many banks are failing to produce a return on tangible equity...
description: Earlier this week the consultancy group McKinsey brought out a report saying banks are facing a “do or die” moment and that roughly a third of them were at risk when the next global downturn hits.
